meanings.definition: To establish or set in a position or place.
meanings.sent1: The king instates his loyal advisor as the new chancellor.
meanings.sent2: The teacher instates the new rule about homework submission.
meanings.sent3: The cat instates itself on the warm spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: The artist instates the vibrant colors in her masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The sun instates its dominance in the sky, casting a warm glow over the land.

meanings.definition: To introduce or bring into existence.
meanings.sent1: The magician instates a sense of wonder with his tricks.
meanings.sent2: The scientist instates a new theory to explain the phenomenon.
meanings.sent3: The chef instates a burst of flavor with the secret ingredient.
meanings.sent4: The author instates a world of magic in her fantasy novel.
meanings.sent5: The gardener instates a sense of tranquility with the blooming flowers.

meanings.definition: To invest with a rank or office.
meanings.sent1: The president instates the general as the head of the military.
meanings.sent2: The company instates a new CEO to lead the organization.
meanings.sent3: The captain jokingly instates the parrot as the ship's mascot.
meanings.sent4: The coach instates the star player as the team captain.
meanings.sent5: The queen instates her loyal subject as the knight of the realm.
